intro: Centropogon david-smithii, commonly known as the David-Smith's centropogon, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
